column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/f6603646f33c3664c3cb3e5faac253b25450a9b1 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

Updated to revert the removal of NULL pointer checks to comply with @laanwj :).\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/dbc0a6aba2cf94aa1b167145a18e0b9c671aef5b for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Don't remove the NULL pointer check here. It is valid to do a setWalletModel(NULL) (for example, as part of a shutdown sequence).\n
What about the change above in setClientModel() should we define as coding-style default that all setModel() functions should include the NULL pointer check?\n
Why remove the null pointer checks here?\n
showNormalIfMinimized signal is a good idea\n
That slot is connected in `WalletView::setWalletModel()`, which covers the walletModel check and `WalletView::setClientModel()` covers the clientModel check.\n

You're correct. Although I don't think the slot gets disconnected when a NULL model would be set later on, so it's not completely impossible to reach here with model being NULL.

If there's anything I've learned in years of writing C++ code it's that there is no such thing as too many NULL pointer checks. Better to be safe than sorry, please just keep it :)
I'm fine with re-adding them ;-). I guess such a check is also not an expensive operation, right?\n
Indeed, it's not, just a 32/64 bit compare, processors can do billions of those per second. It's also only called once per incoming transaction.\n
